contentrichtext.text: {{lunar crater data| latitude=61.4| N_or_S=S| longitude=50.3| E_or_W=W| diameter=64 km| depth=3.2 km| colong=52| eponym=[[Niccolò Zucchi]]}} '''Zucchius''' is a prominent [[moon|lunar]] [[impact crater]] located near the southwestern limb. Because of its location the crater appears oblong-shaped due to foreshortening. It lies just to the south-southwest of the crater [[Segner (crater)|Segner]], and northeast of the much larger walled plain [[Bailly (crater)|Bailly]]. To the southeast is [[Bettinus (crater)|Bettinus]], a formation only slightly larger than Zucchius. The crater rim is symmetrical and shows little significant wear from impacts. The inner wall is [[wiktionary:terrace|terrace]]d, and there is a group of small central peaks that forms a curving arc around the middle of the floor. This crater is believed to have formed during the [[Copernician]] period, within the last 1.2 thousand million years. ==Satellite craters== By convention these features are identified on lunar maps by placing the letter on the side of the crater midpoint that is closest to Zucchius. {| class="wikitable" !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Zucchius !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Latitude !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Longitude !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Diameter |- |align="center"|A |align="center"|61.8° S |align="center"|56.0° W |align="center"|28 km |- |align="center"|B |align="center"|61.8° S |align="center"|54.3° W |align="center"|25 km |- |align="center"|C |align="center"|60.8° S |align="center"|45.2° W |align="center"|22 km |- |align="center"|D |align="center"|61.4° S |align="center"|58.7° W |align="center"|26 km |- |align="center"|E |align="center"|61.3° S |align="center"|60.6° W |align="center"|21 km |- |align="center"|F |align="center"|60.1° S |align="center"|56.5° W |align="center"|8 km |- |align="center"|G |align="center"|60.5° S |align="center"|57.2° W |align="center"|25 km |- |align="center"|H |align="center"|61.0° S |align="center"|59.7° W |align="center"|14 km |- |align="center"|K |align="center"|64.3° S |align="center"|58.0° W |align="center"|10 km |} ==References== {{Lunar crater references}} ==External links== * {{Cite web | author = Jean-Luc Josset and [[Bernard H. Foing]] | date = 1 June 2006 | url = http://www.esa.int/esaMI/SMART-1/SEMVQM9ATME_0.html | title = SMART-1 close-up on Zucchius crater’s central peaks | publisher = European Space Agency | accessdate = 16 June 2006 }} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zucchius (Crater)}} [[Category:Impact craters on the Moon]]
